API Key.description:
BTCPay Server supports authenticating and authorizing users through an API Key that is generated by them. Send the API Key as a header value to Authorization with the format: `token {token}`. For a smoother experience, you can generate a url that redirects users to an API key creation screen.

 The following permissions applies to the context of the user creating the API Key:
 * `unrestricted`: Allow unrestricted access to your account.
 * `btcpay.server.canmodifyserversettings`: Allow total control on the server settings. (only if user is administrator)
 * `btcpay.server.cancreateuser`: Allow the creation of new users on this server. (only if user is an administrator)
 * `btcpay.user.canviewprofile`: Allow view access to your user profile.
 * `btcpay.user.canmodifyprofile`: Allow view and modification access to your user profile.

The following permissions applies to all stores of the user, you can limit to a specific store with the following format: `btcpay.store.cancreateinvoice:6HSHAEU4iYWtjxtyRs9KyPjM9GAQp8kw2T9VWbGG1FnZ`:
 * `btcpay.store.canviewstoresettings`: Allow view access to the stores settings. 
 * `btcpay.store.canmodifystoresettings`: Allow view and modification access to the stores settings.
 * `btcpay.store.cancreateinvoice`: Allow invoice creation of the store.

Note that API Keys only limits permission of a user and can never expand it. If an API Key has the permission `btcpay.server.canmodifyserversettings` but that the user account creating this API Key is not administrator, the API Key will not be able to modify the server settings.
API Key.name: Authorization

Basic.description: BTCPay Server supports authenticating and authorizing users through the Basic HTTP authentication scheme. Send the user and password encoded in base64 with the format `Basic {base64(username:password)}`. Using this authentication method implicitly provides you with the `unrestricted` permission
Basic.name: Authorization
